meanings.definition: The quality or state of being capable of being sold.
meanings.sent1: The vendibility of the product made it easy to sell.
meanings.sent2: The antique store owner considered the vendibility of the old furniture.
meanings.sent3: The vendibility of the broken clock was so high that even the repairman couldn't fix it.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity added a unique vendibility to her handmade jewelry.
meanings.sent5: The bright packaging increased the vendibility of the snacks.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is marketable or in demand.
meanings.sent1: The company's success was due to the high vendibility of their products.
meanings.sent2: The new smartphone's vendibility was evident from the long lines outside the store.
meanings.sent3: The vendibility of the limited edition sneakers caused a frenzy among collectors.
meanings.sent4: His charm and wit added a personal vendibility to his public speaking engagements.
meanings.sent5: The catchy jingle increased the vendibility of the advertisement.
